messages.title: SPEAKING UP FOR YOU
messages.content: As a local campaigner Beki Sellick has worked with the area's Liberal Democrat councillors to help hold the Tory-controlled council to account. She recently used her right - that we all have as citizens - to put a question to council leaders at a meeting of the council.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Beki asked why the council was not looking at things such as electric buses to help tackle the situation.

Following the Brexit vote, enforced the council to consider a petition calling on it to do more to help EU citizens living in Peterborough to apply for UK citizenship - including running English language courses.

issues.brexitEurope: As an MP I would seek to protect the rights of EU nationals and everyone living here.
issues.environment: Beki demanded to know why, despite Peterborough's claims to be an 'environment city', air quality has actually got worse rather than better according to the latest figures.
issues.governance: Beki Sellick has worked with the area's Liberal Democrat councillors to help hold the Tory-controlled council to account.
issues.immigration: She forced the council to consider a petition calling on it to do more to help EU citizens living in Peterborough to apply for UK citizenship - including running English language courses.

housing.content: Beki is involved: She campaigns on issues such as children's welfare, housing and Fairtrade and chairs her local residents' association.

leaflet.personalStatement: Beki is passionate about trying to make the world a fairer place - as a political campaigner, a community volunteer and a Liberal Democrat.

politicalExperience.role: Liberal Democrat parliamentary candidate for Peterborough

images.caption: Beki Sellick, Liberal Democrat parliamentary candidate for Peterborough, after being interviewed on BBC Radio.
Beki Sellick with local Liberal Democrat councillors Nick Sandford, Asif Shaheed and Simon Barkham.
